attributes.action: Agencies to pay furlough to school supply staff
attributes.additional_details:
The agency's are not listening to their staff pleading to be furloughed.  Reasons being that they can't afford to pay NI and pensions. 
This has been introduced by the government and needs rectifying before thousands are forced into poverty.
attributes.background:
There are thousands of school supply workers whom have been refused furlough from their agencies.  School supply staff have helped keep schools open from September to December. 
Now all school supply staff are looking at at least 7 weeks without pay. This is based on schools reopening in February.

rejection.details:
Deciding whether to furlough staff is a decision for indiviudal employers, not the Government or House of Commons, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: 

Review income replacement schemes for school supply staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/567772
